snippet: The Internet and the mounting popularity of naturally textured curls and braids have enabled African-American women to claim a bigger share of hair products industry.
abstract: Black entrepreneurs, mostly women, are seeking bigger share of hair products and beauty industry, opening brick-and-mortar stores that cater to black women; across nation, black owners number only a few hundred among roughly 10,000 stores that sell such products; most are owned by Korean-Americans, phenomenon dating back to 1970s that has stoked tensions between black consumers and Korean businesspeople.
lead_paragraph: The Internet and the mounting popularity of naturally textured curls and braids have enabled African-American women to claim a bigger share of hair products industry.

headline.main: Black Women Find a Growing Business Opportunity: Care for Their Hair
headline.print_headline: Black Women See Openings for Business in Hair Care
